Patch Set 23: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as ba6971b9ae69e99a80beceea505b121680456164
LGTM, a couple of comments inline
.. missed a bit of recvfrom()ing in my earlier review.
Do we still need this compat layer? If you just declare that you need recent kernel headers (which provide all of this), then you should be fine to drop this whole file.
True!
super minor style nit: you have (const == var) here, and (var == const) below.
Ack

connect() is not yet hooked up for AF_MCTP. However, since you're using sendto(), this is redundant anyway.

Or (looking at the values you're passing to addr), did you mean bind()?
You're right, I don't need this.

The usual rationale for doing a recvfrom(MSG_PEEK) is to then use the returned length to allocate an appropriately-sized receive buffer for the actual (non-PEEK) recvfrom later.

However, you're not doing that here - you're just passing the length back to another recvfrom() (and that might overrun pldm_resp_msg!)

Given you're not doing a buffer allocation here, I would suggest simplifying this into just:

    recvfrom(socket, *pldm_resp_msg, *resp_msg_len, MSG_TRUNC, ...)
    
ie, directly into pldm_resp_msg. You will be able to tell if the incoming message was truncated if the return value is greater than the length you passed.
Good spot -  I had accidentally deleted the buffer allocation
Done

The addr argument to recvfrom() is an output: it gets populated by the kernel with data from the incoming message. 

You don't use addr below (after the recvfrom) anyway though. Don't you need to know which EID the message is coming from? I'd suggest doing the usual recvfrom sanity checks:

 - that addrlen large enough to hold an MCTP addr (ie, >= sizeof(addr)) 
 - smctp_family == AF_MCTP; and
 - smctp_addr == eid.
 
Or, if you're not using the output addr values, just use recv() instead,
I somehow missed that you commented! Fixed.

I've done some nitpicking here too, however, I'd prefer we `s/afmctp/af_mctp/` across all file and symbol names. `afmctp` seems like a surprising choice to me given the `socket()` parameter is `AF_MCTP`.
yeah, my laziness is showing 😄
These two appear in the demux transport implementation as well, maybe we add a `src/mctp_ids_codes.h` or something?

If we do this, then we should also pull out the `pldm_transport_XX_get_eid` functions too. We decided not to do that because the mctp-demux implementation is going to be moved away from, and so having mctp specific files wouldn't make sense then. Happy to pull it all out if things have changed or you think mctp-demux will be around for awhile.

I disagree. These values are generic to the MCTP base specification and are not implementation details like the `pldm_transport_*_get_eid()` functions. They are useful to potential transport implementations beyond mctp_demux and af_mctp if we consider that freestanding environments will likely have to provide their own. While we'll be (effectively) deprecating the mctp_demux transport I don't expect that we'll be deleting it any time soon.
Ack
void
Done
Need to translate the error cases to `pldm_requester_rc_t`
n/a anymore.
function symbol name needs fixing here (`s/_mctp_/_afmctp_/`).
Ack
Don't need an `else` clause given the return in the `if` body (early exit)
Ack
`void`
Done
Can we not just inline the `socket()` call? Do we really need this function?
Done
Please fix the formatting here. Needs more new-lines.
Done
In some system, there is only one or two terminus. For in MCTP_MAX_NUM_EID can reduce the performance.
Miss understood the code. The code is corrected.

This changed is applied in the added file of patch set https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/59576/19.
Let remove these changing and apply it in the above patch set.
The same comment for adding src/mctp_defines.h
Done
Check the value of eid with MCTP_MAX_NUM_EID.

The `tid_eid_map` array is sized at `MCTP_MAX_NUM_EID`. `mctp_eid_t` is `typedef`ed to `uint8_t`, and `MCTP_MAX_NUM_EID` happens to be the same value as `UINT8_MAX`. So technically no test is required.
Ack
Sorry, I meant `UINT8_MAX + 1U` there, but my poor wording didn't make the code unsafe at least :D
Check the value of eid with MCTP_MAX_NUM_EID.
as above.
Ack
Dirrectly checking length with sizeof(struct pldm_msg_hdr) because min_len is only used in this line.
Done
Same comment on the API/ABI as on the instance ID and mctp-demux transport APIs.
Done
Why `b`? I guess I have the same question for the macro...
whoops, remnants from when I called it `binding` rather than `transport`. Fixed.
Cast is unnecessary
Ack
This one, on the other-hand, is required. Thanks POSIX.
Ack
Why `b`?
Done
Need `close(b->socket);` before `free(b);`
Ack
